intro: Ekebergia velutina, commonly known as the velvet tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It produces long, slender pods that contain flat, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. Ekebergia velutina is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and unique seed structure.
